body_html: decode_csv returns what I think you mean by 2-D data as a list of 1-D tensors (two dimensions in total). I think it should be sufficient, but in any case we can't change it to return a 2-D tensor since (1) it wouldn't handle variable types and (2) it wouldn't be backwards compatible.
body_text: decode_csv returns what I think you mean by 2-D data as a list of 1-D tensors (two dimensions in total).  I think it should be sufficient, but in any case we can't change it to return a 2-D tensor since (1) it wouldn't handle variable types and (2) it wouldn't be backwards compatible.
body: `decode_csv` returns what I think you mean by 2-D data as a list of 1-D tensors (two dimensions in total).  I think it should be sufficient, but in any case we can't change it to return a 2-D tensor since (1) it wouldn't handle variable types and (2) it wouldn't be backwards compatible.
